item.title: Enable Hibernation for Lenovo Z500 on Ubuntu 12.04
item.description: Using Terminal add this file: sudo gedit /etc/polkit-1/localauthority/50-local.d/com.ubuntu.enable-hibernate.pkla This: [Re-enable hibernate by default] Identity=unix-user:* Action=org.freedesktop.upower.hibernate ResultActive=yes Save & reboot Source

item.title: Hotkeys (special keys) Volume/Brightness Controls Don't Work After Suspend
item.description: What seems to solve this problem on Ubuntu 12.04 LTS (Lenovo Z500): Open this file: sudo gedit /etc/default/grub Modify the line as this: GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX="noapic" Close it and run the following: sudo update-grub Restart your computer Source

item.title: Suspend Laptop When Lid Closed Ubuntu 12.04 LTS in Lenovo Z500
item.description: I guess this is a bug. Although suspend is set in Power settings, it doesn’t suspend the laptop when its lid is closed. To solve it, I’ve found a workaround on web. Here is how you implement it: Generate folder if it’s not present: sudo mkdir /etc/acpi/local Set its permissions: sudo chmod 755 /etc/acpi/local Generate the script: sudo gedit /etc/acpi/local/lid.sh.post Copy-paste the following: #!/bin/bash grep -q closed /proc/acpi/button/lid/*/state if [ $?
